senses.lear_examp: This is the scene where in a card game between pig Napoleon and human Pilkington, the other animals, who secretly watch the game through the window, find it impossible to distinguish between pigs and humans.

senses.sense: to make one person or thing seem different from another

senses.lear_examp: A person distinguishes himself from others by different tastes, manners, characters.

senses.sense: to be able to see, hear or understand something

senses.lear_examp: I could distinguish nothing in the darkness and was scared to death.

senses.sense: a disagreement, especially one that lasts a long time

senses.sense: to disagree with something someone says

senses.sense: to make someone stop giving their attention to something

senses.sense: a very long piece of writing done as part of a course of study

senses.sense: when something is stopped from happening as it should

senses.sense: clear and certain

senses.sense: easy to hear, see, or smell

senses.sense: the feeling of being extremely upset or worried

senses.sense: when someone or something is in danger and needs help

senses.sense: making you feel extremely worried or upset

senses.lear_examp: My dream was to become a professional singer.

senses.sense: to not notice things that are around you because you are thinking about something else
senses.lear_examp: The first time I saw a fashion  show, I was 10 years old and I was in a dream during the whole show.

senses.sense: bigger or better than anything you could imagine or hope for
senses.dict_examp: The house was beyond my wildest dreams.
senses.lear_examp: It was beyond my wildest dreams.

senses.sense: used to say that something is better than anything you could imagine or hope for
senses.dict_examp: Never in my wildest dreams had I thought I would be offered a starring role in a Hollywood movie.
senses.lear_examp: Not even in my wildest dreams could I have imagined that finding a diary was to have such fortunate consequences for me.

senses.sense: to experience events and images in your mind while you are sleeping
senses.dict_examp: What did you dream about last night?
senses.lear_examp: It ran, ran, and I screamed - I was dreaming, but it was very real.

senses.sense: to imagine something that you would like to happen
senses.dict_examp: He never dreamed that one day he would become President.
senses.lear_examp: I have always dreamed of becoming a famous tennis player.

senses.sense: used to say that you would not do something because you think it is wrong or silly
senses.dict_examp: I wouldn't dream of asking him for a loan.
senses.lear_examp: Many people wouldn't dream of spending hours in a kitchen preparing a complex meal.

senses.sense: a box-shaped container without a top which is part of a piece of furniture. It slides in and out to open and close and is used for keeping things in.
senses.dict_examp: I keep my socks in the bottom drawer.
senses.lear_examp: I think I left it in your drawer in the living room.

senses.sense: severe and sudden or having very noticeable effects
senses.dict_examp: drastic measures
senses.lear_examp: If within 30 days I don't receive any kind of compensation (preferably money), I may have to take drastic measures.

senses.sense: very sudden or noticeable, or full of action and excitement
senses.dict_examp: a dramatic change/improvement
senses.lear_examp: His suicide at the end of the book was the most dramatic event in this story and has touched me deeply.

senses.sense: to be moved slowly somewhere by currents of wind or water
senses.dict_examp: Smoke drifted across the rooftops.
senses.lear_examp: As the clouds drifted past it, the light slowly returned.

senses.sense: to get into a situation or job without having any particular plan
senses.dict_examp: He drifted into acting after college.
senses.lear_examp: But once Stevens had noticed their working relationship was slowly drifting into a kind of love affair, he proposed to stop these evening meetings on account of their being not useful in a professional sense any more.

senses.sense: If two people drift apart, they gradually become less friendly and the relationship ends.
senses.dict_examp: Roz used to be one of my closest friends, but we've drifted apart.
senses.lear_examp: Later on in our relationship we started to drift apart because, being a student from Canada, I had a lot of problems with Portuguese which led to my failure at the end of the school year.

senses.sense: to gradually start to sleep
senses.dict_examp: I drifted off during the lecture.
senses.lear_examp: She unwillingly let her mind drift off to her business trip in Milano.

senses.sense: a piece of furniture with drawers for keeping clothes in
senses.dict_examp: I keep my socks in the top drawer of the dresser.
senses.lear_examp: I think I have left my notebook in your house. It's probably in your bedroom on the dresser.

senses.sense: wearing clothes and not naked
senses.dict_examp: I usually get dressed before I eat breakfast.
senses.lear_examp: While I got dressed he started to cook the dinner.

senses.sense: wearing clothing of a particular type
senses.dict_examp: a well-dressed/casually dressed man
senses.lear_examp: Last Saturday, there was a big party and everyone was well dressed.

senses.sense: in a drastic way
senses.dict_examp: The number of bees has drastically declined due to a combination of factors.
senses.lear_examp: Conditions have changed drastically after the reunification.

senses.sense: a bird that lives by water, has webbed feet, a short neck and a large beak
senses.dict_examp: We took some bread to feed the ducks.
senses.lear_examp: There was a big lake, with a lot of ducks.

senses.sense: If criticisms, insults, etc. are like water off a duck's back to you, they do not affect you at all.
senses.dict_examp: She calls him lazy and useless, but it's like water off a duck's back.
senses.lear_examp: The main lesson I have learned is by looking at some people who have lived alone for most of their life and faced with neither contradiction nor argument, they stay in their ivory tower, so sure of their opinions that whatever you say is like water off a duck's back.

senses.sense: to move or travel on land in a motor vehicle, especially as the person controlling the vehicle's movement
senses.dict_examp: I'm learning to drive.
senses.lear_examp: I need them to drive my car.

senses.sense: to make someone extremely annoyed
senses.dict_examp: My mother-in-law has been staying with us this past week and she's driving me crazy.
senses.lear_examp: It drove me crazy.

senses.sense: to make someone have a bad feeling or do something bad
senses.dict_examp: The arguments drove her to leave home.
senses.lear_examp: She would discover all about her affair with Lorraine's husband and the real cause that drove him to commit suicide.

senses.sense: to provide the power or energy that makes someone or something work
senses.dict_examp: She was driven by greed and ambition.
senses.lear_examp: On the other hand, we are reassured by large international corporations that everything is under control, but it is common knowledge that these capitalistic monsters are so driven by greed for money and power that they would say anything to calm down the public.

senses.sense: to force someone or something to leave a place
senses.dict_examp: The supermarket has driven many small shops out of the area.
senses.lear_examp: Unfortunately that kind of thinking led to many people being killed, wounded and made homeless and moreover driven out of their homeland.

senses.sense: a journey in a car
senses.dict_examp: The drive from Boston to New York took four hours.
senses.lear_examp: This restaurant is about a 1 hour drive from my home.

senses.sense: a part of a computer that can read or store information
senses.dict_examp: Save your work on the C drive.
senses.lear_examp: Then we learned how to install components like a Soundboard or a CD-Rom drive.

senses.sense: energy and determination to achieve things
senses.dict_examp: She has drive and ambition.
senses.lear_examp: They definitely have the drive and motivation to succeed.

senses.sense: to put something somewhere to get rid of it, especially in a place where you should not put it
senses.dict_examp: The company was fined for illegally dumping toxic chemicals.
senses.lear_examp: In addition, society might be affected negatively by the refuse and garbage dumped by people.

senses.sense: to put something somewhere quickly and carelessly
senses.dict_examp: Henry dumped his bag on the table and went upstairs.
senses.lear_examp: Annabel dumped her school bag on the floor and threw herself onto her bed.

senses.sense: to suddenly end a romantic relationship
senses.dict_examp: If he's so awful, why don't you just dump him?
senses.lear_examp: I had just been dumped by a guy I thought I was in love with.

senses.sense: a place where people take things that they do not want
senses.dict_examp: We took our old mattress to the dump.
senses.lear_examp: We all took turns loading it and driving it off to the city dump, in our private cars.

senses.sense: a place that is dirty and messy
senses.dict_examp: His room is a dump.

senses.sense: to be unhappy
senses.dict_examp: He looks a bit down in the dumps.
senses.lear_examp: She felt happy when I was down in the dumps or in a fix and kept on being jealous of me concerning trivial matters.

senses.sense: official permission for someone to drive a car, received after passing a driving test, or a document showing this
senses.dict_examp: I have a clean driving licence.
senses.lear_examp: At first we were scared that we won't be allowed to come in the club cause the club is aged by 18 years and normally you had to show your driver's license.

senses.sense: thought not to be completely true, honest, or legal
senses.dict_examp: dubious evidence
senses.lear_examp: He was blackmailed, his children were twice kidnapped and his wife was badly injured in mysterious and dubious circumstances.

senses.sense: not certain that something is good or true
senses.dict_examp: He's dubious about the benefits of acupuncture.
senses.lear_examp: As far as entertainers are concerned, I am rather dubious about their contribution to a better world.

senses.sense: to fall or to allow something to fall
senses.dict_examp: She dropped her keys.
senses.lear_examp: Maybe this is the reason why I dropped my cup of tea.

senses.sense: to move something on  a computer screen using a mouse and place it where you want it to be
senses.dict_examp: drag and drop exercises
senses.lear_examp: With simple mouse-clicks and by means of the well-known "drag-and-drop" method, this programme will enable you to select a fabric from the catalogue and "drop" it on a chair or couch, to see what they look like.

senses.sense: to move to a lower level, or cause something to move to a lower level
senses.dict_examp: The water level in the flooded region has finally begun to drop.
senses.lear_examp: Especially if you imagine that the number of heart-attacks was about 40% per year and for the last 3 years dropped down to 23%.

senses.sense: to stop doing or planning something, especially an activity
senses.dict_examp: I'm going to drop yoga and do aerobics instead.
senses.lear_examp: I think you shouldn't drop sports but on the other hand, if you drop sports and do music, it would be quite good as well.

senses.sense: to take someone or something to a place, usually by car as you travel somewhere else
senses.dict_examp: I can drop you at the station on my way to work.
senses.lear_examp: You had better hire a car or get to know somebody who can drop you there.

senses.sense: to stop talking about something, especially because it is annoying or upsetting someone
senses.dict_examp: I don't want to talk about it any more - let's drop the subject.

senses.sense: to die very suddenly
senses.dict_examp: He just dropped dead.
senses.lear_examp: We can enjoy our longer lives because we don't have to work until we drop dead.

senses.sense: a small round-shaped amount of liquid
senses.dict_examp: I thought I felt a drop of rain.
senses.lear_examp: I could only hear the drops against the window-pane.

senses.sense: a reduction in the amount or level of something
senses.dict_examp: a drop in crime
senses.lear_examp: It maintained the same level between 1998 and 2008 after a drop from 1996 to 1998.

senses.sense: a vertical distance down from somewhere to the ground
senses.dict_examp: It's a drop of about 50 feet from the top of the cliff.

senses.sense: a very small amount compared to the amount needed
senses.dict_examp: My letter of protest was just a drop in the ocean.
senses.lear_examp: I know I am a drop in the ocean, but I'm convinced it's the only way, my way, of contributing to improve education in Mexico.

senses.sense: describes something that has no water or other liquid in, on, or around it
senses.dict_examp: My hat kept my hair dry.
senses.lear_examp: So when the clothes were dry, I called a taxi.

senses.sense: with no or not much rain
senses.dict_examp: a dry summer
senses.lear_examp: It said: "My sweet darling, the weather here in Africa is hot and dry, but the nights are cold and lonely without you."

senses.sense: Dry wine is not sweet.
senses.dict_examp: I'd like a glass of dry white wine.
senses.lear_examp: The only wine sold - a dry white wine of a very good quality - is the one made by the owners of the restaurant and I can assure you that it's worth trying it.

senses.sense: Dry skin or hair does not feel soft or smooth.
senses.dict_examp: My lips feel really dry.
senses.lear_examp: She looked old, her skin was dry and her eyes so lucid... .

senses.sense: If a book, talk, or subject is dry, it is not interesting.
senses.dict_examp: His writing is always so dry and dull.
senses.lear_examp: Facts and dates are dry and empty if teachers are not able to bring them to life.

senses.sense: to become dry, or to make something become dry
senses.dict_examp: Will this paint dry by tomorrow?
senses.lear_examp: I invited him to come inside and dry his clothes and have a cup of tea.

senses.sense: If a supply of something dries up, it ends.
senses.dict_examp: The work dried up and he went out of business.
senses.lear_examp: Nevertheless we must consider that a society with many people over sixty has its problems, such as retirement funds which have dried up.

senses.sense: expected to happen, arrive, etc. at a particular time
senses.dict_examp: What time is the next bus due?
senses.lear_examp: It is my science assignment which is due on Tuesday, so I have no time to research and write it again.

senses.sense: because of
senses.dict_examp: A lot of her unhappiness is due to boredom.
senses.lear_examp: First of all, I want to say that France is the best place to cycle, due to its mountains and fantastic forests.

senses.sense: at a suitable time in the future
senses.dict_examp: The results will be sent to you in due course.
senses.lear_examp: I look forward to hearing from you in due course.

senses.sense: If you are due for something, it should happen very soon.
senses.dict_examp: I'm due for a check-up at the dentist's.
senses.lear_examp: The facilities and canteen are due for improvement too.

senses.sense: used to politely disagree with or give a negative opinion about something
senses.dict_examp: I’ve been thinking about what you said and, with all due respect, I think you’re mistaken.
senses.lear_examp: Finally we would like to point out two things that should be improved. The first one is entertainment, which, with all due respect, is very poor.

senses.sense: Something that is due to you is something that is owed to you or something you deserve.
senses.dict_examp: He didn't get the praise and recognition that was due to him.
senses.lear_examp: Slowly she walked into the living room, knowing that a big apology was due to her.

senses.sense: correct and suitable
senses.dict_examp: He was fined for driving without due care and attention.
senses.lear_examp: However, we should take due care not to make wrong assumptions and be prejudicial to others as a consequence.

senses.sense: unable to behave or speak normally because of having had too much alcohol
senses.dict_examp: He got very drunk at my sister's wedding.
senses.lear_examp: So, I just sat down watching Julie and her monstrous friends drinking and acting like animals - they were all blind drunk!

senses.sense: having two parts, or having two of something
senses.dict_examp: dual nationality
senses.lear_examp: I have dual nationality.

senses.sense: a round, hollow musical instrument that you hit with your hand or a stick
senses.dict_examp: a bass/snare/kettle drum
senses.lear_examp: I am a very good drummer because I have played the drums for six years.

senses.sense: a long period when there is no rain and people do not have enough water
senses.dict_examp: A severe drought ruined the crops.
senses.lear_examp: We have wars, revolutions, political unrest, famine, drought, pollution, etc. Some of our problems are difficult to solve.

senses.sense: not interesting or exciting in any way; boring
senses.dict_examp: She wrote dull, respectable articles for the local newspaper.
senses.lear_examp: In my opinion the film was very boring because the story was poor and dull.

senses.sense: not bright
senses.dict_examp: dull colors
senses.lear_examp: The color of our house from an outside view is dull yellow, and every time I look at it, it reminds me of the past so I would have it painted something brighter so that I would not feel bad.

senses.sense: stupid
senses.dict_examp: a dumb idea/question
senses.lear_examp: Please forgive me, I can be so dumb sometimes!

senses.sense: physically unable to talk
senses.dict_examp: The child is deaf and dumb.
senses.lear_examp: The first one is "Lessons of Piano". It is the story of a dumb woman who uses a piano to express her feelings and moods.

senses.sense: any natural or artificially made chemical which is used as a medicine
senses.dict_examp: anti-cancer/fertility/pain-killing drugs
senses.lear_examp: A great many drug companies all over the world have reduced input of dangerous chemicals into rivers, lakes and seas.

senses.sense: any natural or artificially made chemical which is taken for pleasure, to improve someone's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it
senses.dict_examp: illegal drugs
senses.lear_examp: Of course, I have never taken drugs.

senses.sense: to die because you are under water and cannot breathe, or to kill someone in this way
senses.dict_examp: Two people drowned in a boating accident yesterday.
senses.lear_examp: Those days we spent in Brazil were full of excitement and I certainly wouldn't mind doing it again - well, except for the episode in which you almost drowned when we went water-skiing.

senses.sense: If a loud noise drowns the sound of something else, it prevents that sound from being heard.
senses.dict_examp: His voice was drowned out by the traffic.
senses.lear_examp: It is furthermore impossible to listen to music as it is drowned by the noise.

senses.sense: someone who drives a vehicle
senses.dict_examp: a bus/truck/taxi driver
senses.lear_examp: If you don't know the place exactly ask the driver.

senses.sense: a store where you can buy medicines, other health products, make-up and products used for washing yourself
senses.dict_examp: I can pick up the shampoo while I'm at the drugstore.

senses.sense: for the whole of a period of time
senses.dict_examp: They work during the night and sleep during the day.
senses.lear_examp: We sat together during the lesson.

senses.sense: at some time between the beginning and the end of a period
senses.dict_examp: I woke up several times during the night.
senses.lear_examp: Last year, the strangest thing happened to me during the Christmas period.

senses.sense: to put something somewhere to get rid of it, especially in a place where you should not put it
senses.dict_examp: The company was fined for illegally dumping toxic chemicals.
senses.lear_examp: In addition, society might be affected negatively by the refuse and garbage dumped by people.

senses.sense: to put something somewhere quickly and carelessly
senses.dict_examp: Henry dumped his bag on the table and went upstairs.
senses.lear_examp: Annabel dumped her school bag on the floor and threw herself onto her bed.

senses.sense: to suddenly end a romantic relationship
senses.dict_examp: If he's so awful, why don't you just dump him?
senses.lear_examp: I had just been dumped by a guy I thought I was in love with.

senses.sense: a place where people take things that they do not want
senses.dict_examp: We took our old mattress to the dump.
senses.lear_examp: We all took turns loading it and driving it off to the city dump, in our private cars.

senses.sense: a place that is dirty and messy
senses.dict_examp: His room is a dump.

senses.sense: to be unhappy
senses.dict_examp: He looks a bit down in the dumps.
senses.lear_examp: She felt happy when I was down in the dumps or in a fix and kept on being jealous of me concerning trivial matters.

senses.sense: to keep thinking or talking about something, especially something bad or unpleasant
senses.dict_examp: I don't want to dwell on the past.
senses.lear_examp: Considering this astonishing technical feature, I do not wish to dwell too long upon the subject.

senses.sense: Duty-free goods are things you can buy and bring into a country without paying tax.
senses.dict_examp: I bought some duty-free perfume at the airport.
senses.lear_examp: We went to get some alcohol in a duty-free shop.

senses.sense: digital versatile disc or digital video disc: a disc used for storing and playing music, films or information
senses.dict_examp: I've got a DVD of the first series.
senses.lear_examp: ALL our friends were there and I got a new DVD!

senses.sense: the amount of time that something lasts
senses.dict_examp: The singer remained in the hotel for the duration of his stay in the UK.
senses.lear_examp: If you are between 18 and 30 years old, we offer you a wide range of jobs with a duration varying from two weeks to three months.

senses.sense: full of ideas, energy and enthusiasm
senses.dict_examp: She's young and dynamic and will be a great addition to the team.
senses.lear_examp: I am a cheerful, dynamic and hardworking person.

senses.sense: continuously changing or moving
senses.dict_examp: a dynamic economy
senses.lear_examp: Consequently, the country has a less dynamic economy.

senses.sense: covered with dust
senses.dict_examp: a dusty old chair
senses.lear_examp: Not a sound could be heard in the dusty street except for the continuous roar of my almost useless pick-up.

senses.sense: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
senses.dict_examp: I felt it was my duty to tell them the truth.
senses.lear_examp: It is not enjoyable if you look at it as a duty.

senses.sense: something you do as part of your job or because of your position
senses.dict_examp: professional/official duties
senses.lear_examp: And it is the most important duty of the local police to keep an eye on hooligans.

senses.sense: If someone such as a doctor or a soldier is on duty, they are working, and if they are off duty, they are not working.
senses.dict_examp: What time are you off/on duty tomorrow?
senses.lear_examp: I was on duty in front of the major's house with another soldier.

senses.sense: dry dirt in the form of powder that covers surfaces inside a building, or very small dry pieces of soil, sand or other substances
senses.dict_examp: The furniture was covered in dust.
senses.lear_examp: Also, in the countryside there are more bugs and dust than in the city.
